message: My current favorite: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bitstream_Vera
second favorite: http://www.levien.com/type/myfonts/inconsolata.html
I use the amazingly clean, readable, beautiful Terminus: http://fractal.csie.org/~eric/wiki/Terminus_font
Inconsolata user here, tho I use it for my terminal at large and do not use gVim :)
Monaco on OSX and Inconsolata on windows
My current one is Dejavu Sans Mono http://dejavu-fonts.org/wiki/Main_Page
currently using Andale Mono (size 10)
I use Envy Code R http://damieng.com/blog/2008/05/26/envy-code-r-preview-7-coding-font-released
Consolas is very good on Windows.  I use something similar on Ubuntu, but can't recall what.
I tend to switch between Envy Code R, DejaVu Sans Mono and Droid Sans Mono
Been pretty happy with Menlo http://9-bits.com/post/123940811/menlo-font-macosx
Consolas user here too. Got used to it by using Visual Studio and it looks really nice in Vim.
I use vim in a terminal, and my terminal font is Proggy Square (Slashed Zero) http://www.proggyfonts.com/index.php?menu=download
I been using Liberation Mono lately, but Terminus  is also pretty good.
Monaco, 9pt
Lately I've been going back and forth between Droid Sans Mono Dotted and Anonymous Pro in both the terminal and gVim/MacVim.

Started using terminus a few years ago but quickly switched to profont. Been using profont for about 2 years until a few days back when I started using Monte Carlo for normal and bold text and profont for italic. Lovely combination!
You have to jump through a few hoops to get it (on OS X), but Consolas is definitely my favorite http://www.wezm.net/technical/2010/08/howto-install-consolas-font-mac/

My favourite vim font is the one that comes with xterm on linux (gentoo). Except I don't know it's name or if there's a ttf for that at all. I really like its clarity and 1/l/I and O/0 etc differences
If someone knows how to get exactly this font as ttf/etc please tell, I miss it in gui vim version and on windows and everywhere!
It could be that I just got used to it before.
Monaco, 14pt, aliased, OS X
Consolas, 12pt, anti-aliased, Arch Linux
are there any good programming fonts with embedded bitmaps for small and reasonable (9,10,12,14) sizes?
DejaVu Sans Mono
@dion Another way to get the fonts on OSX - just adjust this script slightly for the different environment: http://plasmasturm.org/log/457/
+1 for monaco (11pt), best choice for those of us too lazy to install new fonts
Monaco 11pt
And before that, Consolas 11pt
Another vote for DejaVu Sans Mono. It was one of the few terminal fonts I could find with most of the Unicode glyphs
Monaco 12pt
Droid Sans Mono, 14pt
Consolas on Windows, Inconsolata on OSX. MingLiu as guifontwide on Windows for mixed character sets.
+1 for Menlo.
Anonymous Pro http://www.ms-studio.com/FontSales/anonymouspro.html
Droid Sans Mono FTW!
Used inconsolata for a long time, but have just been using menlo lately. Comes pre-installed on macs and is nice.
monaco is great.
